definition: to impair/to degrade/to decrease/to reduce/to weaken/to detract from/impairment (e.g. of financial assets)
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Serious injury refers to the all-around and major derogation suffered by the domestic industries.
sentences.chinese: 嚴重損害是國內產業受到的全面的和重大的減損。

sentences.english: That, however, in no way detracts from its enormous utility.
sentences.chinese: 但是這並不會減損對它們的巨大使用量。

sentences.english: The parties may not derogate from or vary the effect of this article.
sentences.chinese: 合同各方不得減損或改變本條款的效力。

sentences.english: Interceptions also detract from planetary power.
sentences.chinese: 劫奪也會減損行星的能量。

sentences.english: Nothing  took away from the beauty of the scenery.
sentences.chinese: 什麼也減損不了這景色的美。

sentences.english: The Derogation request must describe the Deviation and the associated planning to remedy.
sentences.chinese: 要求減損必須描述偏差所在及其相關的補救計劃。

sentences.english: Derogation from the common law rule is developed for an old rule.
sentences.chinese: 減損規則是從英美法發展起來的一項古老的規則。

sentences.english: That subtracts nothing from his merit.
sentences.chinese: 那絲毫也沒有減損他的功績。

definition: to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to reduce/to lessen (pain etc)/to deduct (from taxes)
